meanings.sent1: The plant's leaves grew tripinnately, with each leaflet dividing into three smaller parts.
meanings.sent2: She observed the branches of the tree tripinnately spreading out in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar moved tripinnately along the stem, looking like a tiny acrobat performing tricks.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts raced tripinnately through his mind, making it hard to focus on one idea.
meanings.sent5: The wind danced tripinnately through the meadow, causing the flowers to sway in unison.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having leaves or leaflets arranged in three pinnate divisions
meanings.sent1: The botanist identified the tripinnately arranged leaves as a unique feature of the plant.
meanings.sent2: The tripinnately divided leaves provided a beautiful pattern on the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a tripinnately designed masterpiece, with each plant perfectly placed.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tripinnately organized library, with thoughts neatly categorized into sections.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a tripinnately structured tree, capturing the intricate beauty of nature.
